trans-unit.source: How to reset a password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines
trans-unit.target: How to reset a password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Quickly reset a local administrator password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines using the Azure preview portal or PowerShell commands.
trans-unit.target: Quickly reset a local administrator password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines using the Azure preview portal or PowerShell commands.

trans-unit.source: How to reset a password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines
trans-unit.target: How to reset a password or the Remote Desktop service for Windows virtual machines

trans-unit.source: If you can't connect to a Windows virtual machine because of a forgotten password or a problem with the Remote Desktop service configuration, use the Azure preview portal or the VMAccess extension to reset the local administrator password or reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you can't connect to a Windows virtual machine because of a forgotten password or a problem with the Remote Desktop service configuration, use the Azure preview portal or the VMAccess extension to reset the local administrator password or reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article does not apply to virtual machines created in Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article does not apply to virtual machines created in Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Preview portal
trans-unit.target: Preview portal

trans-unit.source: To reset the Remote Desktop service in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse all** > **Virtual machines (classic)** > *your Windows virtual machine* > **Reset Remote Access**.
trans-unit.target: To reset the Remote Desktop service in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse all** > **Virtual machines (classic)** > *your Windows virtual machine* > **Reset Remote Access**.

trans-unit.source: The following page appears.
trans-unit.target: The following page appears.

trans-unit.source: To reset the name and password of the local administrator account in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse all** > **Virtual machines (classic)** > *your Windows virtual machine* > **All settings** > **Password reset**.
trans-unit.target: To reset the name and password of the local administrator account in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse all** > **Virtual machines (classic)** > *your Windows virtual machine* > **All settings** > **Password reset**.

trans-unit.source: The following page appears.
trans-unit.target: The following page appears.

trans-unit.source: VMAccess extension and PowerShell
trans-unit.target: VMAccess extension and PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, you'll need the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, you'll need the following:

trans-unit.source: The Azure PowerShell module, version 0.8.5 or later.
trans-unit.target: The Azure PowerShell module, version 0.8.5 or later.

trans-unit.source: You can check the version of Azure PowerShell that you have installed with the **Get-Module azure | format-table version** command.
trans-unit.target: You can check the version of Azure PowerShell that you have installed with the **Get-Module azure | format-table version** command.

trans-unit.source: For instructions and a link to the latest version, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=320552&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For instructions and a link to the latest version, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=320552&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: The new local administrator account password.
trans-unit.target: The new local administrator account password.

trans-unit.source: You don't need this if you want to reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.
trans-unit.target: You don't need this if you want to reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.

trans-unit.source: The VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: The VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: The VMAccess extension doesn't need to be installed before you can use it.
trans-unit.target: The VMAccess extension doesn't need to be installed before you can use it.

trans-unit.source: As long as the VM Agent is installed on the virtual machine, the extension is loaded automatically when you run an Azure PowerShell command that uses the **Set-AzureVMExtension** cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: As long as the VM Agent is installed on the virtual machine, the extension is loaded automatically when you run an Azure PowerShell command that uses the **Set-AzureVMExtension** cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: First, verify that the VM Agent is already installed.
trans-unit.target: First, verify that the VM Agent is already installed.

trans-unit.source: Add the cloud service name and virtual machine name, and then run the following commands at an administrator-level Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Add the cloud service name and virtual machine name, and then run the following commands at an administrator-level Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: If you don't know the cloud service and virtual machine name, run **Get-AzureVM** to display that information for all the virtual machines in your current subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know the cloud service and virtual machine name, run **Get-AzureVM** to display that information for all the virtual machines in your current subscription.

trans-unit.source: If the **write-host** command displays **True**, the VM Agent is installed.
trans-unit.target: If the **write-host** command displays **True**, the VM Agent is installed.

trans-unit.source: If it displays **False**, see the instructions and a link to the download in the [VM Agent and Extensions - Part 2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=403947&clcid=0x409) Azure blog post.
trans-unit.target: If it displays **False**, see the instructions and a link to the download in the [VM Agent and Extensions - Part 2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=403947&clcid=0x409) Azure blog post.

trans-unit.source: If you created the virtual machine with the Azure portal, run the following additional command.
trans-unit.target: If you created the virtual machine with the Azure portal, run the following additional command.

trans-unit.source: This command will prevent the “Provision Guest Agent must be enabled on the VM object before setting IaaS VM Access Extension” error when running the **Set-AzureVMExtension** command in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: This command will prevent the “Provision Guest Agent must be enabled on the VM object before setting IaaS VM Access Extension” error when running the **Set-AzureVMExtension** command in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Now, you can do these tasks:
trans-unit.target: Now, you can do these tasks:

trans-unit.source: Reset a local administrator account password.
trans-unit.target: Reset a local administrator account password.

trans-unit.source: Reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.
trans-unit.target: Reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.

trans-unit.source: Reset the local administrator account password
trans-unit.target: Reset the local administrator account password

trans-unit.source: Add the current local administrator account name and the new password, and then run the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Add the current local administrator account name and the new password, and then run the following commands.

trans-unit.source: If you type a different name than the current account, the VMAccess extension renames the local administrator account, assigns the password to that account, and issues a Remote Desktop log off.
trans-unit.target: If you type a different name than the current account, the VMAccess extension renames the local administrator account, assigns the password to that account, and issues a Remote Desktop log off.

trans-unit.source: If the local administrator account is disabled, the VMAccess extension enables it.
trans-unit.target: If the local administrator account is disabled, the VMAccess extension enables it.

trans-unit.source: These commands also reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.
trans-unit.target: These commands also reset the Remote Desktop service configuration.

trans-unit.source: Reset the Remote Desktop service configuration
trans-unit.target: Reset the Remote Desktop service configuration

trans-unit.source: To reset the Remote Desktop service configuration, run the following command.
trans-unit.target: To reset the Remote Desktop service configuration, run the following command.

trans-unit.source: The VMAccess extension runs these two commands on the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: The VMAccess extension runs these two commands on the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: netsh advfirewall firewall set rule group="Remote Desktop" new enable=Yes
trans-unit.target: netsh advfirewall firewall set rule group="Remote Desktop" new enable=Yes

trans-unit.source: This command enables the built-in Windows Firewall group that allows incoming Remote Desktop traffic, which uses TCP port 3389.
trans-unit.target: This command enables the built-in Windows Firewall group that allows incoming Remote Desktop traffic, which uses TCP port 3389.

trans-unit.source: Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKLM:\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' -name "fDenyTSConnections" -Value 0
trans-unit.target: Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKLM:\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' -name "fDenyTSConnections" -Value 0

trans-unit.source: This command sets the fDenyTSConnections registry value to 0, enabling Remote Desktop connections.
trans-unit.target: This command sets the fDenyTSConnections registry value to 0, enabling Remote Desktop connections.

trans-unit.source: If this did not solve your Remote Desktop access problem, run the [Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package](https://home.diagnostics.support.microsoft.com/SelfHelp?knowledgebaseArticleFilter=2976864).
trans-unit.target: If this did not solve your Remote Desktop access problem, run the [Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package](https://home.diagnostics.support.microsoft.com/SelfHelp?knowledgebaseArticleFilter=2976864).

trans-unit.source: In the diagnostics package, click **Microsoft Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package** to create a new diagnostics session.
trans-unit.target: In the diagnostics package, click **Microsoft Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package** to create a new diagnostics session.

trans-unit.source: On the **Which of the following issues are you experiencing with your Azure VM?** page, select the **RDP connectivity to an Azure VM (Reboot Required)** issue.
trans-unit.target: On the **Which of the following issues are you experiencing with your Azure VM?** page, select the **RDP connectivity to an Azure VM (Reboot Required)** issue.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Microsoft Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2976864) Knowledge Base article.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Microsoft Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2976864) Knowledge Base article.

trans-unit.source: If you were unable to run the Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package or running it did not solve your problem, see [Troubleshoot Remote Desktop connections to a Windows-based Azure virtual machine](virtual-machines-troubleshoot-remote-desktop-connections.md).
trans-unit.target: If you were unable to run the Azure IaaS (Windows) diagnostics package or running it did not solve your problem, see [Troubleshoot Remote Desktop connections to a Windows-based Azure virtual machine](virtual-machines-troubleshoot-remote-desktop-connections.md).
